text: Just for clarification, the bug i’m seeing isn’t autoplay videos, it’s just html5 videos in general don’t work in safari other than from the cdn
Is there a way to use a choice module in a custom module, to then show a bit of HTML depending on the choice?
I'm trying to show a certain number of stars depending on what is selected by the user
<@U2LEJ045D> yes. You probably just need to add qoutations around the five_stars since it's a string.
Oh cool thanks <@U7V9DQ31P>
I'll try that now
if that doesn't work you could also try adding '.value` to the end of `'item.number_of_stars`
yup that did it - thanks <@U7V9DQ31P>
nice!
yeah I tried that before
and it didn't work
but the quotes around worked
thanks again!
<@U2LEJ045D> Thank you!
did that work for you <@UDGCWGA7M>?
Totes! I wish I understood why it worked, but that can wait for another day. :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah for sure - I was really perplexed by that too. I checked the code, the file, nothing was wrong
so I hosted from another portal and it worked
glad it worked for ya <@UDGCWGA7M>

Hey folks! *Important note about SSL*

For any of you/customers whom have standard SSL (free SSL), many of these certificates we provisioned are just now or soon expiring. We will auto-renew the cert for you, however, we will not be able to if a domain has a Certification Authority Authorization (CAA) record, which does not include <http://digicert.com|digicert.com> (`0 issue "<http://digicert.com|digicert.com>"`), the certificate authority which will provision SSL for your subdomains. If you have no CAA record, you have nothing to action. *If you do have a CAA record, ensure <http://digicert.com|digicert.com> is listed*.

Here is an example of how to check to see if your domain has CAA records and if digicert is already listed: <https://www.digwebinterface.com/?hostnames=causeway.com&type=CAA&ns=resolver&useresolver=8.8.4.4&nameservers=>
Note: You check the apex domain, not a subdomain
Here is an example domain with no CAA records, which requires no action: <https://www.digwebinterface.com/?hostnames=friendlydeveloper.com&type=CAA&ns=resolver&useresolver=8.8.4.4&nameservers=>
Does anyone know if it’s possible to schedule the publication of a staged page?

I have yet to start putting any css / js in my custom modules, so pardon my ignorance with this question:  Does adding css / js in a custom module create a seperate js / css file when its loaded on a page?  If so does it get wrapped into a compiled js / css file so there is only 1 include or is a separate request for every custom module css / js file?
code put in the css and js panes of a custom module gets minified and combined with all other custom modules loaded on a page. It is 1 request.

when working on your custom module you can use the hsdebug param(or extension debug button) which will cause all of the modules css and js files to be separated on the page so you can more easily troubleshoot
